entry.title: House in Sumiregaoka / Design Associates Nakamura
entry.summary: The roof is divided into small volumes that harmonize with the city. The slope direction of each roof is varied to create a continuity with the cityscape.

entry.title: Symbiosis University Hospital and Research Centre / IMK Architects
entry.summary: Occupying the lower slopes of a hill within Symbiosis International University‚Äôs 260-acre estate in Lavale, Symbiosis University Hospital and Research Centre (SUHRC) is a 41,800-square-metre, 216-bed, multi-specialty hospital that represents a new and progressive face for healthcare infrastructure in India. With its state-of-the-art healthcare facilities and a research centre to enhance skill development, it is firmly anchored today as a COVID-19 quarantine and treatment facility, contributing to Maharashtr‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Silo / Cobe
entry.summary: The Silo is part of the transformation of Copenhagen‚Äôs Nordhavn (North Harbour) ‚Äì a vast post-industrial development, currently being transformed into a new city district. Designed by Danish architects COBE with clients Klaus Kastbjerg and NRE Denmark, a 17-storey former grain silo and the largest industrial building in the area has been transformed into ‚ÄúThe Silo‚Äù, housing residential apartments and public functions.

entry.title: Funky Monkey NFTs ‚Äî 1,000 limited-edition monkey NFTs that help save rainforests
entry.summary:
‚Äú Hello PH, we wanted to experiment with creating NFTs that positively impact our planet. Collecting and trading cute NFTs is great, but what if your NFTs could also help preserve natural rainforests?
The Funky Monkeys smart contract is programmed so that when you adopt a monkey, 50% of that Ether goes into the wallet of The Rainforest Foundation US - a non-profit organization focused on tackling major challenges like: deforestation, the climate crisis, and human rights violations.

entry.title: Berkley House / RSAAW
entry.summary: A thorough mid-century interior renovation, taking a tired inefficient house with good bones to a contemporary home on another level. In a market trending towards disposable fixtures and finishes, where it has become commonplace to demolish to make way for the latest trend, RSAAW‚Äôs renovation ensured the home stayed rooted to its origin, simply adapting to perform to superior efficiency levels and to accommodate future generations of family life.

entry.title: Cassiopeia Treehouse / Madeiguincho
entry.summary: Being almost invisible for the surrounding area and with a very low impact on the territory, Cassiopeia Tree House embraces at its core a playground for kids with multiple routes that include a fire-man pole, a slide, a swing, a zip-line, a net bed, monkey bars and a climbing wall in sculptural form with legs that grow in the garden.

entry.title: Bredanportti Apartments / Playa Architects
entry.summary: The project is located in Kauniainen, Finland. The terraced residential building is low-cost state subsidized rental housing situated next to the Koivuhovi train station. The height of the building varies from two to five floors as it climbs the steep site. The fa√ßade is also stepped to break down the scale even further and to provide extensive views from the balconies. Thus the building adapts both to the terrain and the smaller scale surroundings.

entry.title: Teahouses: Reinterpretation of Traditional Spaces
entry.summary: Chashitsu, which is the Japanese term for a teahouse or tea room is a construction specifically designed for holding the Tea Ceremony, a traditional Japanese ritual in which the host prepares and serves tea for guests. Teahouses are usually small, intimate wooden buildings, where every detail is intended to help withdraw the individual from the material disturbances of the world.

entry.title: Hospital Nova / JKMM Architects
entry.summary: The Finnish hospital sector had been stuck for a long time, suffering from aging hospital facilities and a lack of new healthcare models. The old Jyv√§skyl√§ hospital in central Finland was a prime example. Hospitals needed to be rethought and research was an effective way to begin the process of thinking outside the box. In 2012, Hospital Nova became a real project with JKMM selected as architects. Construction began in 2016 and was completed in 2020. Patients were admitted this year. What is unique about Ho‚Ä¶

entry.title: Honua ‚Äî Rate photos to create your personal tour guide
entry.summary:
‚Äú Whenever I wanted to leave for a day trip on the weekend, we were going to the same places, as nobody wanted to read travel guides. Honua is the tour guide app for the Instagram generation. Just look at photos to find interesting places to visit.
Initially only a few regions are available. But I also included world wide "bucket list" locations. More regions will be added gradually and I also eventually plan to include the option to upload your own photos to share with the community.
I would love‚Ä¶

entry.title: Comet ‚Äî Open API editor for nerds
entry.summary:
‚Äú Hello everyone. Comet is an open-sourced, web-based editor for openAPI. I made it mainly because I didn't find a good alternative for the swagger editor but I still use openAPI a lot in my daily works. So... if you have the same issue, just give it a go and all suggestions are welcomed :) ‚Äù
Discussion | Link

author.name: Product Hunt ‚Äî The best new products, every day

entry.title: BeMyJourney ‚Äî Plan Italy trip in 3 steps, download itinerary for free
entry.summary:
‚Äú Having visited over 60 countries worldwide ‚Äì mostly secluded like Galapagos, Svalbard and Ladakh ‚Äì I have always been driven by the pursuit of authenticity and unique experiences. Inspired by my travel style, for a long time foreign friends have asked me for suggestions and recommendations when planning their journeys in Italy, my home country. Motivated by these conversations, I decided to take the plunge and share these special places and experiences on Be MyJourney ‚Äù
Discussion‚Ä¶

author.name: Product Hunt ‚Äî The best new products, every day

entry.title: Spawn ‚Äî 500GB+ database copies for dev and CI in under 30 seconds
entry.summary:
‚Äú Hi Product Hunt!
We built Spawn after having our own frustrations with trying to get production-like database copies to support our development and CI workflows.
üê¢ Stop waiting for database restores
Waiting hours for the restore of a database backup to a dev box for isolated copies always took forever. And using a shared instance risked trampling over other colleagues changes.
We'd had enough of the database being the thing that slowed us down. So we started building Spawn as a way to solve t‚Ä¶

entry.title: World's Largest Single-Domed Greenhouse Design Unveiled
entry.summary: Not-for-profit Zuecca Projects and Coldefy have shared new research for Tropicalia, the largest single-dome greenhouse on the planet, for the 17th International Architecture Exhibition ‚Äì La Biennale di Venezia. Presenting tropical fauna and flora, the team is also sharing the architectural and engineering specificities of the Tropicalia greenhouse with its unique sustainable air treatment engineering.

entry.title: When Novelty Follows Function: The Kitschy Designs of Duck Architecture
entry.summary: Design can sometimes be mundane- except when it‚Äôs novelty architecture. These buildings uniquely and identifiably break away from the abstract, metaphorical, and often monotonous buildings that have classified modern-day design. Instead of favoring the steel and glass skyscrapers that serve as landmarks in cities around the world, they aim to poke fun at architecture in a way that‚Äôs jovial, commercial, and perhaps slightly more functional and expressive. Unlike other buildings, they are the literal embodime‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ksaraah Residence / Taliesyn Design & Architecture
entry.summary: Nestled in lush coconut and areca tree plantations with the mighty Savandurga Hill ‚Äì one of the largest monolith hills in Asia ‚Äì framing its backdrop, Ksaraah is a weekend retreat in rural Bengaluru, India, that reimagines living in the embrace of nature. It aims to foster a direct connection with the outdoors, sans boundaries, while still sheltering its inhabitants ‚Äì a creative professional and her family.

entry.title: Korean Pavilion at the 2021 Venice Biennale Reimagines Traditional Schools
entry.summary: Titled "Future Schools", the Korean Pavilion at the 17th International Architecture Exhibition - La Biennale Di Venezia, transforms the structure into an explorative academic facility. Curated by Hae-Won Shin, the pavilion will be on display at the Giardini from May 22nd until November 21st, 2021.

entry.title: How To Improve the Acoustics of a Room
entry.summary: If you live in an apartment, you may unintentionally know the details of your neighbor's life by overhearing conversations through your shared walls. Or you keep awake when the dog that lives in the apartment above decides to take a walk in the middle of the night. If so, you may live in an apartment with inadequate sound insulation in its walls and/or slabs. As cities grow increasingly dense and builders seek to increase their profit margins, it is not uncommon for acoustic comfort to be overlooked in many‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sheet Monkey for Notion ‚Äî Connect your forms to Notion
entry.summary:
‚Äú Hey everyone, to celebrate the public launch of Notion's API, I decided to write a full-fledged integration with Sheet Monkey! It seemed like the perfect fit.
I documented the process on Twitter here: https://twitter.com/LeviNunnink/status/1392916509391921154
Please be aware, this is a beta integration as Notion's API is still in beta. Hit me up if you run into any issues. ‚Äù

entry.summary: Posted by Siamak Shakeri, Staff Software Engineer and Oshin Agarwal, Research Intern, Google Research Large pre-trained natural language processing (NLP) models, such as BERT, RoBERTa, GPT-3, T5 and REALM, leverage natural language corpora that are derived from the Web and fine-tuned on task specific data, and have made significant advances in various NLP tasks. entry.title: DataSource.ai 2.0 ‚Äî Community-funded data science tournaments
entry.summary:
‚Äú Hello hunters!
We're launching version 2.0 of the data science competitions. Here the competitions are quite different.
- It's a community-funded data science tournament. - We run short-term tournaments - The competitions go through playoffs, with: quarterfinals, semifinals, and finals. - Each of this stages has different dataset releases, under the same ML problem. This faithfully simulates the input of new real data, and the improvement of the model (via re-training) based on them. It also kee‚Ä¶

author.name: Product Hunt ‚Äî The best new products, every day

entry.title: Contemplation House / Virginia Kerridge Architect
entry.summary: Set in a magical setting in the hills of Byron Bay the house has an extraordinary view of the sea and sky, and sits in a private rural and rainforest setting. All seasons of nature are observed firsthand by this house on the hill. The owners are very interested in the philosophy of Indigenous peoples and these philosophies are reflected in the design. Among ideas explored was the idea of the life of a man being a circle from childhood to childhood; another was the idea of connectivity with nature.

entry.title: Urban Joinery House / Lisa Cummins Architect
entry.summary: This renovation to a 100 year old Victorian cottage is located in the inner-city Melbourne suburb of Brunswick, Australia. The context is unique in its proximity to an historic brickworks factory that contains striking brick chimneys that form a backdrop to this urban site.

entry.title: Notion n8n Integration ‚Äî Connect your Notion workspace to your favorite apps
entry.summary:
‚Äú I am very excited to finally launch the Notion integration for n8n today.
Looking forward to seeing all the amazing things the community will build with it!
For the people that do not know n8n: n8n is an extendable workflow automation tool that enables you to connect anything to everything via its open, fair-code model.
You can either use our hosted version: https://n8n.cloud (30-day free trial) or you can self-host it totally for free: http://n8n.io / https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n
Your feedb‚Ä¶

entry.title: Pachacamac House / del Solar arquitectos
entry.summary: The house is located on the outskirts of the city of Lima, in the valley of the Lur√≠n river, which resists the last surrounding green natural stronghold. The project started with the desire to keep alive the memory of the family refuge, a space for contact and sharing in the open air. The hills, the path of the sun, the trees, and the occupation of the existing land determined the location of the main volume and the design of all the spaces, both interior, and exterior. What started as a vacation retirement‚Ä¶

entry.summary: The DNA of Murillo Housing originated in its implementation. entry.title: House BLOM / STAM architecten
entry.summary: A dark house, situated on a small lot enclosed from almost all sides created a challenging project for STAM architecten. The old building was demolished and made way for a house filled with natural light. By providing indoor terraces and large glass surfaces, natural light reaches every floor and room.

entry.title: Foster + Partners Designs Sustainable Masterplan in Bangkok
entry.summary: Foster + Partners have shared the design for a residential-led masterplan on the outskirts of Bangkok. Dubbed The Forestias, the project includes a large forest at its heart. The design was made to address the growing disconnect between contemporary city life and family traditions. The Forestias proposal focuses on promoting multi-generational family co-living and new models of urban life in Thailand.

entry.title: Golden Handcuffs

entry.title: Removing an empty base class can break ABI
entry.summary: Earlier this week Eric Fiselier pointed out something that came as an unpleasant surprise (to me, at least): Even though C++11 deprecated inheritance-from-std::unary_function, and C++14 deprecated inheritance-from-std::iterator, the actual library vendors cannot remove those deprecated relationships from their libraries without taking an ABI break! This is eerily apropos to Bryce Adelstein Lelbach‚Äôs closing keynote at C++Now 2021, in which ABI breakage was a major theme. Background C++98 didn‚Äôt have auto, s‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sometimes You Have To Just Start Talking
entry.summary:
I have been enjoying a few of James Propp's essays recently. Last month he wrote about the creation of zero. In
Who Needs Zero, he writes:
But in mathematics, premature attempts to reach philosophical clarity can get in the way of progress both at the individual level and at the cultural level. Sometimes you have to just start talking before you understand what you're talking about.
This reminded me of a passage by Iris Murdoch in Metaphysics as a Guide to Morals, which I encountered in
‚Ä¶

entry.title: Using Morph for Deploying to NixOS
entry.summary: Using Morph for Deploying to NixOS Managing a single NixOS host is easy. Any time you want to edit any settings, you can just change options in /etc/nixos/configuration.nix and then do whatever you want from there. Managing multiple NixOS machines can be complicated. Morph is a tool that makes it easy to manage multiple NixOS machines as if they were one single machine. In this post we're gonna start a new NixOS configuration for a network of servers from scratch and explain each step in the way. nixos-conf‚Ä¶
